results.title: The Titfield Thunderbolt
results.creator_credit: Charles Crichton, Michael Truman, Michael Balcon Productions and Ealing Studios
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Forever Ealing”.
When an antiquated railway line is threatened with closure, the villagers decide to run it themselves, entering into frenzied competition with the local bus route. Stanley Holloway as Mr Valentine, the village soak, becomes the railway benefactor and sets the wheels in motion. The antics of this eccentric rural community will provide a comic treat, while train lovers will appreciate the quest to save an old steam engine.

results.title: The Titan: story of Michelangelo (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Richard Lyford, Robert Snyder and Pandora Films
results.brief_description: Covers the life and work of Michelangelo, placing his art in its historical context. This tribute creates a memorable impression of the artist’s greatness and the abundant beauty he willed to the world. Adapted in part from Curt Oertel’s ‘Michelangelo: life of a titan’ with a musical score by the noted German conductor Alois Melichar. Described by filmmaker and critic James Agee as “a new and exciting way to see some of the greatest work ever done”, the film was awarded an Oscar in 1951 for the Best Feature Documentary. Narrated by Fredric March. Presented by Robert Flaherty.

results.title: The Tiny terrors
results.creator_credit: Joseph Koenig, Tim Wilson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: They are out for your blood and they will probably get it, but fighting a rear-guard action on your behalf is the scientist discovering new ways to combat the menace of the biting fly. In government and university entomology laboratories, a full-scale study of insect behavior and methods of mosquito larvae control is under way.

results.title: The Tiny Carnivores
results.creator_credit: Peter Du Cane and David Moore
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Fauna”.
In this huge country most of the carnivorous mammals are tiny, and many are marsupials. Typically they are small but fierce predators of insects, spiders and grubs, but some - notably the native cats and Tasmanian Devil - are larger and more formidable. The program explores the behaviour of these animals.

results.title: The Tin soldier. The Nightingale
results.creator_credit: Chris Schouten, Richard Morrison, Wang Bairong, W. H. Stevens, Shanghai Animation Films, Crawleys Animation and Atkinson Film Arts
results.brief_description: Two delightful animated children’s stories from the classic Hans Christian Anderson fairy tales, narrated by Christopher Plummer. “The Tin Soldier” is about friendship and love between a music box ballerina and a tin toy soldier. “The Nightingale” is an enchanting tale set in the mystical land of ancient China.

results.title: The Tin drum
results.creator_credit: Volker Schlondorff, Franz Seitz and New World Pictures
results.brief_description: Winner of an Academy Award for best foreign film, this is the story of Oskar, a small boy, born into the feast and famine, the facism and slaughter of Germany during the rise of Hitler and the Third Reich. At three, he’d already had enough of this violent and confused world and decides he’d be better off to remain a three-year-old forever. Incredibly, he remains frozen in size and faces life with two weapons… his tin drum- which he bangs to drown out horror and lies… and his childish voice which he raises to a piercing shriek which breaks glass. German language with English subtitles.

results.title: The Times of Harvey Milk
results.creator_credit: Robert Epstein, Richard Schmiechen and Black Sand Productions
results.brief_description: An exceptionally moving documentary about Harvey Milk, the first openly gay candidate elected to San Francisco’s Board of Supervisors. A courageous activist, Milk worked hard to express the political concerns of not only gays and lesbians, but also of African-Americans, Hispanics and other so- called American minorities. After 11 months in office, Milk and the Mayor of San Francisco were assassinated by Dan White, a conservative member of the Board of Supervisors. The subsequent trial, in which White received a lenient sentence, resulted in massive rioting in San Francisco by gay and lesbian activists. Amidst the tragedy the film builds a convincing and impassioned picture of a man committed to human rights and human dignity. (Awards: Academy Award winner for best documentary, 1985)

results.title: The Times of Harvey Milk
results.creator_credit: Robert Epstein, Richard Schmiechen, Harvey Milk Film Project and Black Sand Productions
results.brief_description:
An exceptionally moving documentary about Harvey Milk, the first openly gay candidate elected to San Francisco’s Board of Supervisors. A courageous activist, Milk worked hard to express the political concerns of not only gays and lesbians, but also of African-Americans, Hispanics and other so- called American minorities. After eleven months in office, Milk and the Mayor of San Francisco were assassinated by Dan White, a conservative member of the Board of Supervisors. The subsequent trial, in which White received a lenient sentence, resulted in massive rioting in San Francisco by gay and lesbian activists. Amidst the tragedy the film builds a convincing and impassioned picture of a man committed to human rights and human dignity. Academy Award winner for best documentary, 1985.

Credits: Producer, Richard Schmiechen ; director, Robert Epstein ; writer, Judith Coburn, Carter Wilson ; photography, Doug Dunderdale, Nancy Morita, Thomas O’Shea ; music, Mark Isham ; editor, Deborah Hoffmann, Robert Epstein.
Cast: Harvey Fierstein (narrator).

results.title: The Time Tunnel
results.brief_description: The Time Tunnel is a 1966–67 US color science fiction TV series, written around a theme of time travel adventure.

constellations_other.name: Perception, time and flickering images
constellations_other.description: Using a peep hole and a loop of rotating still images, mutoscopes control the point of view of the audience while also creating the illusion of depth. Filmmakers have since put optical tricks to work creating surreal scenes.

results.description: The Time Tunnel is a 1966–67 US color science fiction TV series, written around a theme of time travel adventure. The show was creator-producer Irwin Allen’s third science fiction television series, released by 20th Century Fox and broadcast on ABC. The show ran for one season of 30 episodes. Reruns are viewable on cable and by internet streaming. A pilot for a new series was produced in 2002, although it was not picked up.
description_for_label: The Time Tunnel is a 1966–67 US color science fiction TV series, written around a theme of time travel adventure. The show was creator-producer Irwin Allen’s third science fiction television series, released by 20th Century Fox and broadcast on ABC. The show ran for one season of 30 episodes. Reruns are viewable on cable and by internet streaming. A pilot for a new series was produced in 2002, although it was not picked up.

results.title: The Time Travelers
results.brief_description: A time travel experiment that was supposed to produce a window into time turns out to be a portal instead. One of the experimenters steps through into a not-too-distant-future world that has been destroyed by nuclear war.

constellations_other.name: Colour and illusion
constellations_other.description: Exploring the science of colour, light, reflection and movement.

results.description: A time travel experiment that was supposed to produce a window into time turns out to be a portal instead. One of the experimenters steps through into a not-too-distant-future world that has been destroyed by nuclear war. Some of the others follow, but then the portal phases out and they can’t get back. Things just get worse after that. They run across a rocket that has landed to escape pursuing enemies, bearing scientists who survived the war, and many android “slaves.” The time travellers are invited to escape when the ship is again ready to blast off - but just before that happens, the scientits’ enemy returns and fires on the sitting-duck ship. A very bad day for the scientists turns terminal at that point, and the 20th-century Earthlings barely escape with their skins.
